msContents.summary: Prescription for eye salve: the papyrus, written on both sides in the same hand, contains two medical prescriptions complete with titles and directions for use; originally published as accounts for medical supplies; the recto contains a recipe for an eye salve of the type commonly called achariston

msItemStruct.note: Written on both sides of the papyrus; the side published in ed. pr. as recto is written against the fibers, verso is written with the fibers
The hand is a tiny, rapid cursive

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

div.ab: [recto] For children; burnt copper, 4 drachmas [i.e. 96 gr]; calamine, 6 or 8 drachmas; opium, 2 or 4 drachmas; myrrh, 2 1/3 drachmas; erica, 2 drachmas; acacia, 6 drachmas; gum, 6 drachmas; use water until it becomes sufficiently glutinous in thickness. [verso] Station at Fla-: my pepper, 2 drachmas [i.e. 48 g]; litharge, 2 drachmas; myrrh, 4 drachmas; fat, 2 drachmas; gum, 10 drachmas; use wine . . . gum and ingredients.
